subject: Programming
title: What Trees Are
description: A fast breakdown of What Trees Are for builders.

hook.text: A tree is a hierarchy â€” one root, branching into children, each child branching further.

buildup.text: File systems, HTML documents, and organizational charts are all trees hiding in plain sight.

discovery.text: Trees let you narrow a search at each level. Instead of checking everything, you follow a branch.

twist.text: A badly balanced tree degrades into a linked list. All the search advantages disappear.

climax.text: Trees bring order to hierarchical data. Nearly every complex application uses them somewhere.

punchline.text: Branch by branch, trees organize the world.

quiz.question: What happens when a tree becomes badly unbalanced?
options: It degrades into a linked list
